FuncDef:
The nat log host detect icmp command sets the ICMP detection interval and the maximum number of allowed failed detection attempts.
The undo nat log host detect icmp command deletes the ICMP detection interval and the maximum number of allowed failed detection attempts.
By default, the ICMP detection interval is 1s, and the maximum number of allowed failed detection attempts is 3 after heartbeat detection is enabled for log servers.
CLIs: nat log host detect icmp { interval <interval-value> | failed-times <detect-failed-times> | interval <interval-value> failed-times <detect-failed-times> }
undo nat log host detect icmp { interval <interval-value> | failed-times <detect-failed-times> | interval <interval-value> failed-times <detect-failed-times> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an ICMP detection interval.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 60, in seconds. The default value is 1.

Specifies the maximum number of allowed failed detection attempts.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10. The default value is 3.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] nat log host detect icmp interval 5 failed-times 4
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A device needs to deliver log server information based on the log server status. After heartbeat detection is enabled for log servers, to set the ICMP detection interval and the maximum number of allowed failed detection attempts, run the nat log host detect icmp command. If the maximum number of allowed failed detection attempts is reached, the device considers the log server unavailable.
Precautions
The nat log host detect icmp command takes effect on UDP log servers, not TCP log servers.
